description:
Mô Tả Công Việc
             

              EXCELLENT OPPORTUNITY IN FINANCIAL SERVICES INDUSTRY
              
              Diverse range of responsibilities, including but not limited to supporting a newly-formed team to service Sydney based client, new client take on, process improvement and other opportunities.
              

              The major responsibilities of the role are as follows:
              

              Working with clients:
              
              •            Supporting the servicing of clients
              
              •            End-to-end accounts payable function, bank reconciliation and other financial reporting work assigned by the client
              
              •	Preparing and processing month end work and other reporting deliverables
              
              •             Working and delivering against Service Level Agreement (SLA) deadlines
              

              Process improvement/Change Management:
              
              •	Propose better ways  of doing existing processes/Refine standardised processes for each area of service offered, e.g. payroll, accounts payable, trust account/bank reconciliation, month end accounts, AFSL financial compliance, budgets, etc.
              
              •	Document processes in accordance with standardized documentation requirements.
              
              •	Adherence and/or implementation of the standard operating procedures
              
              •	Regular update of policy documents, checklists, templates, and procedures to enhance compliance and reduce operational risk
              
              •	Assist team leader, as required, with training staff in day-to-day workflow including the use of agreed systems, templates and process rationale, etc.
             

              Xem toàn bộ Mô Tả Công Việc
requirement:
Yêu Cầu Công Việc
             

              •       Minimum 1-2 years' experience gained in professional services accounting environment.
              
              •       Some level of accounting experience, Australian-based environment, is preferred.
              
              •       Bonus points: Knowledge of Australia Tax, rules & regulations a plus; good understanding of accounting standards (a must)
              
              •       Bonus points: Experience in Australian payroll calculation, preferred
              
              •       High attention to detail
              
              •       Knowledge and experience of SAP is desirable
              
              •       Ability to work as a part of a team
              
              •       Competent in Microsoft Office/Proficient in Excel spreadsheet and processing
              
              •       Eager to take full responsibility for tasks assigned
              
              •       Good interpersonal skills
              
              •       Good written and verbal English communication skills, comprehensive skills in reading documents.
              
              •	Flexible and able to adapt to change
              
              •	Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and problem solving skills independently and the ability to self-adjustment.
              
              •	Honest, highly motivated, proactive, ability to multi-task
              
              •	Excellent team-player and able to work in a fast-paced environment
              
              •	Competent at business consolidations an advantage – subsidiary’s, associates and JV’s
              
              •	Able to execute sets of agreed processes to ensure efficient, timely and accurate information delivery;  experience in analysing ad-hoc issues
              
              •	Has the initiative to update policy documents, checklists, templates, and procedures
             

              Xem toàn bộ Yêu Cầu Công Việc
